header.title: The Angelical Language Volume I: The Complete History and Mythos of the Tongue of Angels

central_thesis: This book provides an exhaustive, 'Dee-purist' analysis of the Angelical tongue, its history, mythology, and practical application as recorded in Dr. John Dee and Edward Kelley's magical journals, aiming to enable students to understand the language and its underlying mystical traditions for operative magic.

structure_content.summary: This section outlines the book's intensive ten-year project, distinguishing it from typical 'Enochian' magick texts by focusing on the Angelical tongue's history, mythology, and linguistics from Dee's original journals. It contextualizes the work within various magical traditions and highlights the author's aim to provide a 'Dee-purist' perspective on Enochian scholarship, building upon the foundational works that resurrected Dee's system from obscurity.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter One: The Gates of Heaven and the Enochian Tradition
structure_content.summary: This chapter explores the foundational mystical traditions influencing Dee and Kelley's Angelic system. It details the Qabalistic concept of the 'Fifty Gates of Understanding' and the Jewish 'Counting of the Omer,' linking them to spiritual ascension. It outlines the centuries-old Enochian tradition, including apocryphal texts and Enoch's celestial journeys. Finally, it analyzes the mysterious *Book of Soyga* (or *Aldaraia*), revealing its structure, astrological significance, and profound influence on Dee's reception of Angelic magickal squares and tables.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Two: John Dee's Book of Enoch (The Book of Loagaeth)
structure_content.summary: This chapter delves into the *Holy Book of Loagaeth*, received by Dee and Kelley, identifying it as the Christian version of Enoch's Celestial Tablets. It explains the book's origin from 'Speech from God' (the Christos's creative words) and its three types of knowledge (God, Angels, Nature). Details Kelley's visions of the book, its unique right-to-left writing, and the 49 'Tables of Loagaeth,' connecting them to the Seven Days of Creation and the Gnostic Thirty Aethyrs. It also highlights the significance of the First and Forty-Ninth Tables and their relation to End Times prophecy.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Three: The Forty-Eight Angelical Keys (or Calls)
structure_content.summary: This chapter focuses on the transmission and nature of the 48 Angelical Keys, which are long poetic invocations designed to 'open' the mysteries of the *Loagaeth* Tables. It examines Nalvage's unusual transmission methods, including backward spelling and cryptic numerical instructions, leading to cryptographic suspicions. The chapter introduces the *Corpus Omnium* (Round Table of Nalvage) as a representation of God and the source for the Keys' letters. An addendum analyzes the 'Poetry of the Forty-Eight Calls' as apocalyptic writings deeply influenced by Gnosticism and biblical imagery.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter Four: Gebofal—The Gates of Heaven and Practice of the Holy Book
structure_content.summary: This chapter introduces 'Gebofal' as the practical system for ascending through the 49 'Gates of Wisdom' (Loagaeth Tables), mirroring Jewish mystical practices like Counting the Omer and Merkavah mysticism. It outlines the ritual timing and the necessity of using the 'Prayer of Enoch' and the Angelical Keys. It clarifies the purpose of Gebofal: to gain divine understanding and magickal power for 'lawful causes,' wielded against oppressive forces, emphasizing the distinction between spiritual and physical pursuits.

This chapter explores the mythological and linguistic foundations of the Angelical Language. It connects Angelical to Adam's original language in Paradise, its loss after the Fall and the Confusion of Tongues, and its re-reception by Dee. It details the Angelical Alphabet (21 letters, 3x7 structure) and its role in representing the Creation of Man. It then describes Agrippa's methods for generating Angelic names and sigils from astrological data, adapted to the Angelical alphabet and Dee's Heptarchic system for practical talismanic magic.

This section presents the 48 Angelical Keys for practical invocation. Each Key is provided with its English translation and phonetic pronunciation, designed for easy recitation and proper inflection. It also includes a detailed pronunciation key for vowels, consonants, and digraphs in the Angelical Language.

This section provides a collection of Angelical phrases, along with their translations as given by the Angels to Dee and Kelley. These phrases are presented as useful for general prayer, invocation, and evocation, demonstrating instances where Angels spoke in their native tongue and provided collective meanings rather than word-by-word definitions.

key_concepts.definition: The celestial tongue revealed to John Dee and Edward Kelley, believed to be the original language of God and Adam in Paradise. It is central to Dee's magical system, intended for direct communication with Angels and for accessing divine knowledge.

The system of Angelic magic received by John Dee and Edward Kelley through scrying sessions. The author distinguishes this 'Dee-purist' approach from later interpretations (e.g., Golden Dawn), emphasizing its reliance on Dee's original journals and the direct celestial communications.

A holy book revealed to Dee and Kelley, also known as 'The Book of Enoch' or 'Book of Life.' It consists of 49 large tables (49x49 cells) filled with indecipherable Angelical letters, representing the Words of Creation, divine mysteries, and the entire span of the Universe from beginning to end.

Long poetic invocations, often psalms, transmitted by the Angel Nalvage. These Keys are the operative 'keys' intended to 'open' and access the mystical knowledge encoded within the 49 Tables of Loagaeth, activating the forces contained therein. Key Zero applies to the First Table (hidden), and Keys 1-48 apply to Tables 2-49 respectively.

The practical and theurgical process of ascending through the 48 Gates of Wisdom (the Tables of Loagaeth). This 49-day operation involves reciting the 'Prayer of Enoch' and the corresponding Angelical Key over each Table, aiming for divine revelation, spiritual understanding, and the acquisition of magickal power for 'lawful causes'.

key_concepts.term: Fifty Gates of Understanding (Nun Sha'arei Binah)
key_concepts.definition: A Qabalistic concept representing fifty aspects of God, accessible through spiritual progression. The Loagaeth Tables are interpreted as a 'Christianized version' of these Gates, with 49 gates of entrance and a 50th, ultimate gate (Binah itself) representing direct communication with the Creator.

A mystical table revealed by the Angel Nalvage, visually depicted as a large round table like crystal with infinite letters. It represents 'The Body of All' or 'Substance of the Universe,' embodying God the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. Its four circumference names (Lvas, Lang, Sach, Urch) are linked to different cosmological eras, and it is indirectly involved in the transmission and activation of the Angelical Keys.

A unique, twenty-one-letter alphabet used in the Angelical Language. It is described as representing the 'Creation of man' and is structured in three groups of seven letters. Each letter has a phonetic value and can also stand as a word, similar to Hebrew, and is used in the creation of Angelic names and sigils.

Thirty celestial regions or 'Heavens' (from Tables 20-49 of Loagaeth) that extend from God's Throne to Earth. They are subdivided into 91 'Parts of the Earth,' each ruled by Angelic Governors. The Keys Nineteen to Forty-Eight (Call of the Aethyrs) are used to access these realms and their Governors.

Magical characters or objects, often derived from Angelic names and astrological influences. The book describes Agrippa's methods for generating sigils from letters and fashioning talismans incorporating Angelical words, planetary symbols, and relevant biblical verses for specific magical goals.

practical_system.description: The central practical system, 'Gebofal,' is a 49-day spiritual ascension process through the 'Gates of Wisdom' represented by the Tables of Loagaeth. It involves using specially prepared tools, a handwritten copy of the *Book of Loagaeth*, the 'Prayer of Enoch,' and the 48 Angelical Keys. The process is designed to progressively open mystical gateways, leading to divine revelation and the acquisition of magickal power, strictly for 'lawful causes' and spiritual glorification, rather than material gain.
tools: Heptarchic Tools: A set of ceremonial implements including the Holy Table, seven 'Ensigns of Creation' talismans, wax seals, silk coverings, a crystal shewstone, the King of Solomon (a magical ring), and the Holy Lamen. These are used to establish the magical atmosphere and aid angelic manifestation.

The Book of Loagaeth: A carefully constructed, handwritten copy of the book. It must be written in Angelical characters (right-to-left), with each of the 49 Tables (49x49 cells) accurately transcribed. The cover should be light blue silk with the title 'Amzes naghezes Hardeh' in gold Angelical script, opening from the left-hand side (what Westerners consider the back).
Angelical Keys (Calls): The 48 invocations, recited in Angelical with specific phonetic pronunciations, are used to 'open' each of the *Loagaeth* Tables.
Prayer of Enoch: A specific prayer to be recited over the *Loagaeth* Tables during the Gebofal operation.

Magickal Talismans and Sigils: These can be created using Agrippa's methods, adapting them for the Angelical alphabet. They involve deriving Angelic names from astrological charts (e.g., planetary aspects, zodiacal signs) and then blending Angelical letters to form sigils. These can be inscribed on materials appropriate to the associated planet, along with Angelical words of power or biblical verses, and consecrated during specific astrological timings.
rituals: Nine Days of Purification: A preparatory period involving ritual seclusion, abstention, and general purification, ending on Good Friday.

Opening the Gates, Day 1: On the morning after Good Friday, ritual cleansing, entering a consecrated oratory, opening *Loagaeth* to the Second Table, reciting the 'Prayer of Enoch,' and then Key One. Followed by meditation and recording experiences.

Opening the Gates, Days 2 to 48: Daily repetition of the Day 1 process, progressing sequentially through the Third to the Forty-Ninth Tables, each time reciting the 'Prayer of Enoch' and the corresponding Angelical Key. This process is to be done three times a day (dawn, noon, dusk).

Completion, Day 49: On the final day, ritual cleansing, entering the oratory, opening to the first 'hidden' Table, and reciting only the 'Prayer of Enoch' three times. This is the culmination of the ascension, expected to yield divine blessing and manifest results over weeks or months.

relevant_quotes.text: The Angelical Language is the single most comprehensive text ever written on the subject of the Enochian magical system and language of Elizabethan luminary Dr. John Dee. This two-volume magnum opus demonstrates Aaron Leitch's familiarity with practical magic as well as his skill as a meticulous researcher. A must-have book.

The work you are now holding is the end product of an intensive ten-year project. In fact, this undertaking was so massive, I had little choice but to split it between two volumes—the first of which you are currently reading. If you are at all familiar with Dr. John Dee, Sir Edward Kelley, and/or their system of Angelic magick, you may be shocked (and I hope delighted) to discover this is not a typical book about 'Enochian' magick. Instead, it is an exhaustive analysis of the Angelical tongue recorded in Dee's magickal journals—including its history (regarding its reception by Dee), its mythology (as expounded to Dee by the Angels), and (in volume II) its grammar and linguistics. This work does not merely present Angelical, but will actually help the student understand the language.

This first volume—The Complete History and Mythos of the Tongue of Angels—explores the reception of the language by Dee and Kelley, and the biblical mythology behind the language as related to them by the Angels. This alone is a groundbreaking resource, as the full saga of Dee's reception of the magick has never before been told in such depth.

And I saw in the right hand of Him that sat on the Throne a Book with writing upon both sides, sealed with seven seals. And I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, 'Who is worthy to open the Book, and to loose the seals thereof?' And no man in Heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the Book, neither to look thereon. [Revelation 5:1–5]

The Angelical language channeled by alchemist Edward Kelley and recorded by royal astrologer John Dee has mystified magicians, linguists, historians, and cryptographers for generations. It’s even rumored that the language may be an encryption method of some kind, unbroken to this day. This fascinating, in-depth analysis reveals the truth behind the saga of two Renaissance wizards who spoke with angels and received instruction in the celestial tongue.

The Forty-eight Angelical Keys are necessary to access the forty-nine Tables of Loagaeth. In this section I have gathered all of the practical instructions outlined previously, and added them to the instructions for using the Keys. Finally, I have organized all of this into a step-by-step procedure for the performance of Gebofal.

The Holy Book must also be covered in light blue silk. Its title, *Amzes naghezes Hardeh*, is painted (also in Angelical characters, from right to left) onto this cover in gold. I would suggest purchasing shell gold in order to paint the title with real gold. Or, if you have or know someone with the skill to do so, you could have the words gold-leafed instead. Only as a last resort would I use paint merely colored metallic gold. Do not forget: the front cover of *Loagaeth* is what an English speaker would normally consider the back cover! When looking at the title painted on the front, the book should open from the left-hand side.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant for serious students and practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly Enochian magic. It offers a critical 'Dee-purist' perspective, deconstructing centuries of accumulated interpretations to return to the original source material. By detailing the historical, mythological, and linguistic context of the Angelical language as revealed to John Dee, it provides an indispensable foundation for understanding the system's true intent and operative mechanics, moving beyond mere summaries or later adaptations.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience includes academic scholars of Western Esotericism, occultists, Qabalists, Hermeticists, and practitioners of ceremonial magic interested in the original Enochian system of John Dee and Edward Kelley. It is especially useful for those seeking an in-depth, technical understanding of the Angelical language, its cosmology, and its practical application for spiritual development and magical operations, rather than a superficial overview.
